doc.title: Hochschild Mining
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/Hochschild Mining Mara Rosa revised down. Slow ramp into next year.Hochschild Mining Mara Rosa revised down. Slow ramp i_2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 300.00 GBp | Price: 278.00 GBp

Adjusted EBITDA $224.5m, +27% YoY, +2% vs consensus. Disappointing updated Mara Rosa guidance; now 35-45koz (previously 94-104koz). We had previously downgraded to 60koz. Process plant restarted, ramping up, filter repairs ongoing. Revised 2025 guide now 291-319 koz gold equivalent and AISC of $1,980-2,080 per gold equivalent ounce.Model updated for results, revised guidance: 2025E EBITDA -21% to US$425 mn. Price objective to GBp 300 (from GBp 320) still on 1x NPV/DCF, based on 2026E NPV.Reiterate Buy, we like exploration upside from project pipeline and gold/silver leverage.

At the group's Mara Rosa mine in Brazil, as previously flagged, heavy rains, contractor performance issues and challenges with filtering process resulted in a plant shut down for 4 weeks. (See: Heavy rains at Mara Rosa). Guidance now formally revised down to 35-45 koz (was 94-104 koz). We now model 2025E production of c.40koz at Mara Rosa.Processing plant now restarted and is slowly ramping up. Mechanical filter repairs being tested, two filters running, other two expected to come online in October. Tailings thickener ordered, expected online in H1 2026 to enable ramp up to full capacity. Mining continues as planned. New Brazil country manager appointed. Capex guide for asset now $29-30m (previously $11-12m).

We continue to like Hochschild's project optionality and gold/silver leverage. Early drill results from Inmaculada and Mara Rosa are encouraging. We expect an update on the brownfield drilling program towards the end of the year. Development work at Monte Do Carmo continues, FID expected in H1 2026. We are bullish gold and silver and believe both metals will continue to perform on the back of (1) risks/uncertainty in global markets; (2) concerns about US$ status as a reserve asset; and (3) concerns about US fiscal profligacy and independence of the US central bank. For silver specifically, our strategists are calling it to $43.75/oz (nominal) by 2026E on increasing industrial demand, particularly from solar and we expect the silver market to remain in deficit. For gold, our strategist has a target of $4000/oz.

Revenue up \(33\%\) at \(\) 520.0\(million (H1 2024:\) \ \(391.7\) million) Adjusted EBITDA up \(27\%\) at \(\) 224.5\(million (H1 2024:\) \ \(177.1\) million) Basic earnings per share (pre- exceptional) of \(\) 0.12\(H1 2024:\) \ \(0.10\) million) Cash and cash equivalents balance of \(\) 109.8\(million as at 30 June 2025 (31 December 2024:\) \ \(97.0\) million) Net debt of \(\) 202.3\(million as at 30 June 2025 (31 December 2024:\) \ \(215.6\) million) Interim dividend of \(\) \ \(USC1.0\) per share ( \(\) 5.1\(million) FY 2025 Mara Rosa production target revised to 35,000- 45,000 ounces (previously 94,000- 104,000 ounces) Revised operations attributable production target: 291,000- 319,000 gold equivalent ounces (previously 350,000- 378,000 ounces) Revised operations attributable all- in sustaining costs target: \(\) 1,980-\ \(2,080\) per gold equivalent ounce (previously \(\) 1,587-\ \(1,687\) per gold equivalent ounce) Revised Mara Rosa sustaining and development capital expenditure expected to be approximately \(\) 29-\ \(30\) million (includes \(\) 18\(million for remedial activities)
HOC trades on \(0.7x\) P/NPV, below historic average \(1.1x\) . HOC trades on \(2.5x\) EV/EBITDA, below historic average \(3.7x\) .

Our price objective of GBp300 is set at 1x our DCF- derived NPV. Global gold mining peers trade in a range of \(0.9x - 2.5x\) (NEM, GOLD, AEM, KGC, FNV).
We derive our PO based on 1x P/NPV

Source: Company reports, BofA Global Research estimates
BofA GLOBAL RESEARCH

Our price objective of GBp300 is based on 1.0x 2026E NPV multiple, towards the middle of the 0.9- 1.5x historical valuation range. Our assumed WACC is 5% real with no terminal value. As the group continues to ramp up its new Mara Rosa project in Brazil, we think that market view of risk in the shares will decrease and we could / should see higher P/NPV multiples being paid.

Downside risks to our price objective are: risks to silver and gold prices, operational risk, political risk in South America, risks to company guidance on mine life and operational risk on Inmaculada.

Upside risks to our price objective other than commodity price are resolution of dispute with government which allows mines to produce normally, better than nameplate throughput at Inmaculada, higher- than- expected grades at legacy mines, and positive exploration results.
EMEA - Metals & Mining, Steel, Paper Coverage Cluster

Qmethod is the set of BofA Global Research standard measures that serve to maintain global consistency under three broad headings: Business Performance, Quality of Earnings, and validations. The key features of iMethod are: A consistently structured, detailed, and transparent methodology. Guidelines to maximize the effectiveness of the comparative valuation process, and to identify some common pitfalls.
